text: Superb bowl of lor mee. I had the signature bowl. It comes with fried fish, lor bak, chicken bites, fried wanton skin, braised egg and the usual yellow noodles and beehoon. I like it that the gravy is not super starchy, it has more of a runny texture. A really good hearty meal for my brunch. At $5.50 for the large size portion, it's really very reasonable.

I eat the noodles since I was a child when I lived in Tanglin Halt. Love the dry noodles with a mixture of braised shredded chicken, fried fish and braised egg that come with a complimentary small bowl of herbal soup. The owner is very generous with the serving . The price is very reasonable and affordable on the back of rising cost of living.

Best lor mee Iâ€™ve eaten. I choose to have thin bee hoon to absorb all the gooey goodness.
Fried fish is crispy even after absorbing all the gravy. be sure to put generous portion of vinegar, sambal chilli, garlic and chopped chilli.
I enjoyed the fried fish lor mee, the gravy is very tasty. I had the S$3 bowl to have some tummy space for other good food here.
One of the best Lor mee run by a young couple. Combination of fried and braised ingredients. They even have dried version
